ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes
It's required, wouldn't exactly recommend it unless there seemed to be some ethics question in their work.
Summary - Lots of examples of what not to do, which is done in the hopes of scaring you into not embarrassing Yale.
It is required so yes I would recommend it. Beyond that...
Yes, it is useful to know the ethics.
This is a required 3-part ethics seminar.
Definitely I would strongly recommend the course
It is a good course it provides good knowledge on electronic materials.I will recommend to other students.Because the strength I mentioned in the previous question
sure
This is a mandatory class.
Research ethics, mandatory course, title is self-explanatory.
I would recommend this class to every graduate student. ENAS 508 gives a very short but fundamental overview on ethical issues.
Yes. It tells us what to do and what not to do.
Don't plagarize
I would recommend. No one wants trouble in their research.
Do not take it unless required.
Required Ethics course. Helpful.
Its a short time commitment to get the NIH requirements out of the way.
There isn't a choice.

I would describe this class as compact, informative, and overall useful. I would recommend attendance in this class to a fellow student because it is important to know and have experience with the topics covered in the course, and the meetings of this course make other courses more manageable.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Not at all.
It is a required course with minimally helpful information.
I get an idea what I should avoid to happen in my academic carrer.

Some of the topics were more relevant than others. The discussions on determining authorship and references were of particular interest, as most of the other material had been covered in other ethics seminars.
Yes, indeed. It gave me a more systematic view from the basic crystal structure to the properties of the materials
This course provides good fundamental knowledge on electronic materials which is very helpful in my research.
sure
I had no knowledge of any topic being presented prior to this class. I still wish that we received some of the presentation files or relevant links by email after the course was over.
Discussion not deep enough. Just doctrines. I've taken moral philosophy courses, and I know this course could have been better.
This course provided a nice overview on ethics.
Helped clarify a few ethics questions I had myself.
Good requirement for people entering scientific fields.
The course dealt with many topics I was unaware of, and I think it will prove very helpful in my future research life.
Moral lesson is very important for us.
All the info is new and helpful.
I was required to takethis course.
Provided basic information on research ethics and clarified some points of interest such as authorship on papers.
Importance of Research Ethics
As a responsibility course of research, it helps a lot in leading a safe and responsible research

The information presented was very useful and important to know, though without any given resources afterwards, I find that I'm not remembering anything in enough detail for it to have been very helpful. Perhaps taking notes in these lectures would have alleviated this problem or at least receiving some handouts of the main points.

This course reinforced topics that were covered in previous ethics courses. The course provided exposure to the proper aspects necessary for responsible conduct of research and emphasized the manner in which dissertation research should be performed.
